oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Distribution Characteristics and Sampling Strategy Considerations for Plasma Non-Esterified Fatty Acid (NEPA) Testing in Late-Gestation Dairy Cows
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Herdt, Thomas H.
Bartlett, Paul C.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: negative energy balance
plasma NEFA concentration
postpartum disease
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Prepartum negative energy balance, as estimated by plasma NEFA concentration, is a demonstrated, positive risk factor for postpartum disease in dairy cows.1,2 Thus, determination of plasma NEFA concentration is potentially valuable for nutritional monitoring and disease risk assessment in late-gestation cows.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1998; 204
